subproject.corporate outcome: National and local institutions have the capacity to deliver improved justice and security, including safeguarding citizen security, in conflict-affected settings
subproject.description:
Security is among the most basic human needs, and an indispensable platform for sustainable development, durable peace, and the achievement of the UN Millennium Development Goals. In 2006, UNDP Kosovo’s Internal Security Sector Review (ISSR) process developed recommendations for the future of Kosovo’s security sector that can be implemented only with substantial international support. 

There is an urgent need to build capacity within the Kosovo civil service and new security institutions in policy development and implementation as competencies are transferred from international entities to local actors. The initiative Support to Security Sector Development (3SD) will act as an umbrella for UNDP Kosovo’s assistance to the post-status security sector architecture in Kosovo. 3SD will provide support to the implementation of some key security aspects of the Status Settlement, including consonant ISSR recommendations where appropriate, in the form of discrete projects executed in conjunction with the relevant domestic institutions and in coordination with other international actors. This mechanism for deployment of support to institutional capacity and policy development in the security sector will launch as the ISSR Secretariat closes down in the summer of 2007.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: Support to Security Sector Dev

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
